thread.title: Art and Music on MLK Blvd.
thread.title_full: Art and Music on MLK Blvd.

title: Art and Music on MLK Blvd.
text:
Art and Music on MLK Blvd. 
Saturday is the Animate MLK Creative Space event. It is an all day festival celebrating culture and the revitalization of MLK Boulevard. From 3-8pm you can go to 401 MLK Blvd for live music, food and art. "There's a creative vibrancy that's struck Chattanooga in a great way," said Shane Morrow, the director of Jazzanooga. "We want to give our local artists a chance to showcase their work and talent." 10 local artist's work hangs in the pop up art gallery, many of them are artists who worked on the MLK mural. "The MLK neighborhood is full of history, from the old jazz nightclubs to the things happening now," said James McKissic, his art hangs in the gallery. "All of the new organizations, and new businesses. We want them to come and experience the wonderful things in arts and culture happening here in the MLK neighborhood." Art and Music on MLK Blvd. Saturday, October 17 2015, 01:01 PM EDT Related Stories 
Last Update on October 16, 2015 07:09 GMT LAMAR ODOM - TRACING HIS STEPS 
LAS VEGAS (AP) -- He's been in a hospital since Tuesday, as doctors try to save his life. Now authorities are trying to retrace the moves Lamar Odom made before he ended up unconscious in a Nevada brothel. Officials in Nye County say they are trying to figure out what Odom took and when before he was found in his life-threatening situation. Meanwhile Odom's grandmother declined to say how he was doing -- saying she was upset by speculation that her grandson would be taken off life support. Odom's father also wouldn't discuss his son's condition. LAS VEGAS (AP) -- Clashing with the Kardashians? That seems to be what's happening with the owner of the Nevada brothel where Lamar Odom was found unconscious on Tuesday. Love Ranch owner Dennis Hof has been talking to reporters, revealing details about what Odom was doing at his brothel -- including the fact that he was taking herbal forms of the sexual performance drug Viagra and told brothel workers he'd used cocaine. Hof says Khloe Kardashian's reps have asked him to leave the talking to Odom's estranged wife. Hof says he's going to do what he must to protect his business. 
PITTSBURGH (AP) -- Another woman. Another defamation lawsuit against Bill Cosby. This suit is being filed in Pittsburgh by Renita Hill. She was on an educational children's show with the comedian as a teenager -- but says on several occasions, Cosby paid her way to performances, summoned her to his room, offered her an incapacitating beverage -- and molested her. Hill claims when she began refusing the drinks, Cosby told her she couldn't come to any more of his gigs. Her suit alleges Cosby defamed her when she went public with her story. BILL COSBY - MORE DEGREES PULLED 
BOSTON (AP) -- Maybe it would be easier if the all the colleges that plan to let Bill Cosby keep the honorary degrees they gave him would just say so. Instead, one by one -- sometimes two by two -- schools are announcing they are rescinding the degrees they gave the comedian over the years. It's all because of the sex assault scandal involving the comedian. The latest to pull honorary degrees: Tufts University in Massachusetts and Goucher College in Maryland. Both schools say they have notified Cosby of their actions. RANDY QUAID RELEASED FROM CUSTODY 
ST. ALBANS, Vt. (AP) -- Randy Quaid can now find out whether it's easier to defend himself on a vandalism charge as a U.S. citizen than as a fugitive from American justice. The actor has been released from custody in Vermont, freeing him from his fugitive status. Next up -- dealing with California felony charges filed in 2010 after he and his wife were found living in the guesthouse of a home they used to own. The couple fled to Canada and was arrested in Vermont last Friday while trying to re-enter the U.S.
